name: ABC-CLIO eBook Collection
description: ABC-CLIO contains hundreds of e-books covering a multitude of popular culture topics, including cinema, literature, sports, and research topics. An audio device feature is included for every article/book.

name: Gale Academic OneFile
description: General-audience, trade publication and scholarly articles on a wide range of subjects, 1980-current.

name: Academic Search Complete
description: Scholarly and general-audience articles, some 1887-current but mostly 1980-current.

name: Gale OneFile Agriculture
description: Scholarly and general-audience articles 1980-current.

description: Scholarly & technical articles, from 1997 - current, with indexing from 1983 - current.

name: Art Full Text
description: Mostly scholarly articles from 1995 - current, indexing (including of 200,000+ Artnet e-productions) and abstracting 1984- current.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Art Index Retrospective
description: Indexing (not full text) of mostly scholarly journals.

Digital library of art images from museums and other institutions.

Registration for an individual account is required for some features.

name: Berg Fashion Library
description:
E-books and scholarly articles on fashion topics. It also offers an extensive image collection including 1400+ selections from CoPA (Commercial Pattern Archive 1868 to 2000) and a fashion museum directory.

Use an incognito browser to access this resource. Click to watch video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tMrT7gV3j6I

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Bibliography of the History of Art (BHA)
description: Open access index to literature published between 1975 and 2007 on European art from the 4th century to the present, and of North and South American art from the European theft of the Americas to the present.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Business Insights: Essentials
description: Contains 465,000 company profiles and covers company and industry profiles with SWOT, market share, and other financial reports.

name: Business Source Complete -  Business Searching Interface
description: Combined search interface for Business Source Ultimate and Business Source Complete, covering both databases in one interface.

name: Business Source Complete - EBSCO Interface
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for scholarly business journals from 1886 to present. Searchable cited references are provided for more than 1,300 journals.

name: Credo
description: Online reference library containing full-text dictionaries, encyclopedias, and other reference books.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Demographics Now
description: Provides demographic data for any location in the United States, from the national level down to a specific neighborhood

name: Tobe TDG
description: Trend reports & forecasting for fashion.  Use the password listed for Doneger.

name: EBSCOhost eBook Collection
description: Contains full text books, such as reference works, scientific monographs, literature and fiction.

name: Education Source
description: Full-text research database containing education journals, books and conference papers.

name: Energy & Power Source
description: Full-text database of energy and power industry-related journals and magazines.

name: Environment Complete
description: Full-text database that provides access to environment journals and monographs

name: Gale OneFile Environmental Studies & Policy
description: Contains articles from journals and books related to environmental studies and policy

name: ERIC
description: Contains indexed and full-text education literature and resources.

name: FITDIL: FIT Digital Image Library
description: A digital repository consisting of over 100,000 images, including FIT student and faculty work, exhibitions, and instructional resources.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Fashion Snoops
description:
Users are required to create a MY FS account

Trend reports & forecasting for fashion. Use Mozilla/Firefox, Google Chrome, Safari and Internet Explorer (version 10 and up only - older versions of Internet Explorer are not compatible).

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Gale Directory Library
description: Tool for searching across directory e-books that list associations, companies, brands, industries, tradeshows, media, and organizations.

name: Gale eBooks (GVRL)
description: Searchable e-books providing quick information on a variety of topics including business, history, countries of the world, science, education, multicultural studies, social science, and more.

name: Gale OneFile Gardening and Horticulture
description: Peer-reviewed, scholarly, and popular resources on gardening, landscape design, horticulture, and related topics, from 1980 to present.

name: Gale OneFile Gender Studies
description: Peer-reviewed, scholarly, and popular resources on gender studies, LGBTQIA+ topics, women's studies, family, and more from 1980 to present.

name: Gale General OneFile
description: Offering more than 14,000 titles including peer-reviewed, scholarly, general interest, and trade publications on an array of topics including science & medicine, business, economics, literature, drama, politics, careers, technology, and more from 1980 to present.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Greenfile
description: Access to peer-reviewed, scholarly, governmental and popular resources with information on environmental impacts by corporations, governments, and individuals as well as resources for minimizing those impacts.

name: HarpWeek
description: Contains electronic access to Harper’s Weekly, an illustrated 19th century periodical available here from 1857-1912. Harper's Weekly offers insight into 19th-century America on a cumulative week-to-week basis with news stories, illustrations, cartoons, editorials, biographies, literature, and even advertisements that shaped and reflected public opinion in this era.

name: Home Furnishings Retailers Database [Chain Store Guide]
description: Covers buyer contacts and basic information on home furnishings retailers such as IKEA, Rooms To Go, Pier 1 Imports, and more. (To be included, retailers must have two units or operate one unit with sales of at least $10 million. Wholesalers and distributors must have sales of at least $1 million.)

name: Gale OneFile Home Improvement
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing from 1984 to present for more than 4.5 million articles from more than 200 construction, architecture, materials, and home improvement focused titles, covering topics including techniques, tool and material selection, zoning requirements, and more.

name: WGSN Lifestyles and Interiors
description:
Trend reports & forecasting for lifestyles and interiors

Students must create an account and re-activate their account every 90 days: click to create or re-activate account: https://www-wgsn-com.libproxy.fitsuny.edu/accounts/edu

To access WGSN Lifestyle & Interiors:
login via the proxy and then with your WGSN username and password
select the part of the site you wish to use from the top menu under "Fashion"
Use an incognito browser to access this resource.

name: Hoover's Online
description:
Firefox Private and Google Chrome Incognito are supported browsers.

Hoover’s, a subsidiary of The Dun and Bradstreet Corporation (D&B), offers proprietary business information Hoover's provides data on more than 85 million corporations, 100 million people, and 1,000 industries.

Use an incognito browser to access this resource.

name: Humanities Source
description: Humanities Source from Ebsco covers publications in literary, scholarly and creative thought. It provides full text and indexing well-known scholarly journals and publications

description: Literary criticism & reviews, biographies & overviews, and some literary texts.

name: MasterFILE Premier

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Material Connexion
description:
A material database with access to innovative, sustainable materials and technologies from 75+ industries.

New users may set up an account by clicking on “Log In” at the upper right corner and following the prompts.

Faculty may book class tours to visit Material Connexion---appointments are required. Please contact Carli Spina carli_spina[at]fitnyc.edu for details.

name: Mintel Reports
description:
Original market research on product categories, consumer groups, and general trends. Mostly US and Europe-focused.

If you wish to use Mintel's collaboration features, like saved searches and email alerts, then you must "Register for a FREE Account:" Fill-in required information. Enter your FIT email address [firstname_lastname@fitnyc.edu]; no other email address is accepted.

name: MRI-Simmons Insights
description:
A profiling system to gain insights and to understand consumer’s media and
product usage.

University Reporter no longer available. Pocket Piece no longer available.

Use an incognito browser to access this resource

name: New York Times Historical [1851-2016]
description: Full text of every issue, including articles, ads, obituaries, and more. May not contain content exclusive to nytimes.com.

name: New York Times Academic Pass
description:
How do I activate an NYTimes.com Pass?
You can activate an Academic Pass from the NYTimes.com Academic Pass page. Follow the instructions for First Time User below.

To activate an Academic Pass:
You need to have a valid FIT email address.
You must log in to or create an NYTimes.com account with your FIT email address.
You cannot be an existing digital subscriber.
Can I activate a new pass before my current one expires?
No. Each NYTimes.com Pass grants a predefined period of access. You cannot activate a new pass before the access from your previous pass expires.

Please click here for full instructions on how to access New York Times Academic Pass: https://it.fitnyc.edu/kb/nytimes-com-academic-pass/

name: New York Times (Gale)
description: Full-text of the The New York Times from 1985-current. May not contain content exclusive to nytimes.com

name: Gale in Context Opposing Viewpoints
description: Articles, essays, videos, statistics, maps etc. about recent and current social issues.

name: Oxford Art Online
description:
Full text of Grove Art Online
There is a 3-user limit to this database -- please log off when you are finished

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Passport  (Euromonitor)
description: Provides international market intelligence, including economic statistics, on industries, countries, and consumers.

description:
Industry market research covering:
Advertising & Branding, Apparel, Textiles & Fashions, Consumer Products & Services, E-Commerce & Internet,Entertainment, Publishing & Media, Games, Apps & Social Media, Green Technology, and Retail. Also some company profiles for "major companies and mid-size firms" in those industries.

name: Plunkett Research eBook Collection
description:
PDF versions of industry market research annuals:
Advertising & Branding, Apparel, Textiles & Fashions, Consumer Products & Services, E-Commerce & Internet,Entertainment, Publishing & Media, Games, Apps & Social Media, Green Technology, and Retail. Supplemented and updated by Plunkett Research Online

name: Points of View Reference Center

description: Full text content of hundreds of popular magazines and scholarly journals, 1984- current. Includes images and videos.

name: Pop Culture Universe
description: Essays (many with images) covering decades of the 20th and 21st centuries.

description:
Searches 8 Databases at once:

Dissertations & Theses @ Fashion Institute of Technology‎
The Harper's Bazaar Archive‎ (1867 - current)

The Vogue Italia Archive‎ (1964 - current)

The Women's Wear Daily Archive‎ (1910-current)

name: Psychology and Behavioral Sciences Collection (EBSCO)
description: Topics include emotional and behavioral characteristics, psychiatry & psychology, mental processes, anthropology, and observational & experimental methods. Full text articles from 400 journals, coverage dating back to the 1940s.

name: Gale OneFile Psychology
description: Scholarly & general articles, some e-books 1980- present

name: RKMA Market Research Reports
description: Biannual reports on marketing and the consumer behavior. Focuses include entertainment, healthcare, leisure, restaurants, retail, sports, travel and tourism. Coverage dates back to 2011.

name: Salem Press Online
description: Reference e-books including Magill's Literary Annual, Critical Survey of Graphic Novels; american history by decade; Fashion Innovators; Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender Events; Civil Disobedience, Social Justice, Nationalism & Populism, Violent Demonstrations and Race Relations and Nations of the World.

name: Salesman's Guide
description:
Buyer contact lists for retailers across North America. Includes Gift, Houseware and Home Textile Buyers, Independent Sales Representatives and Multi-Line Showrooms, and the Retail Buyer Database.

Click on "sign in" at the top right corner to access the Salesman's Guide.

Reports cannot be downloaded.

name: Gale OneFile Entrepreneurship
description: Trade, scholarly, & general articles, some e-books 1980- present

name: SPIN
description: World's largest database of sponsored funding opportunities. Information on more than 40,000 grants from more than 10,000 global sponsors.

name: Sourcing Journal
description: Global resource for news and information on the supply chain.

name: Textile Technology Complete (TTC)
description: Coverage of scientific and technological aspects of textile production & processing.

name: Underground and Independent Comics, Comix, and Graphic Novels
description: A selection of thousands of comics and graphic novels, plus scholarly and comic related materials.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Vogue Archive
description: Contains every issue of Vogue from 1892 to present. Each issue can be browsed cover-to-cover in searchable full-text format. Each page and image is reproduced in high-resolution color with indexing, enabling images to be searched by garment type, designer, and brand names, among others. All covers, advertisements, fold outs and pictorial features are captured as separate documents,which are also indexed, searchable, and viewable in high-resolution color.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Wall Street Journal (ProQuest)
description: Contains full-text, abstracts, indexing for all articles from the Wall Street Journal from 1984 to present with top news stories and detailed information on the arts, sports, business, and popular culture.

description:
Trend reports & forecasting for fashion

https://www-wgsn-com.libproxy.fitsuny.edu/accounts/edu

login via the proxy and then with your WGSN username and password
select the part of the site you wish to use from the top menu under "Fashion"

name: Woodhead Textile eBook Collection
description: A collection of ebooks on textile technology and science from Woodhead.

name: Gale OneFile World History
description: Contains full-text from scholarly journals and magazines from 1990 to present for more than 400,000 articles on history for novice historians as well as academic researchers.

name: WorldCatDissertations (FirstSearch)
description: WorldCat Dissertations is a database of all dissertations and theses listed in WorldCat, a free to use index of a wide variety of resources, and the tools to help find which libraries hold them.

name: Statista
description: A resource for global market and consumer data.

name: WindowsWear
description:
Contains images, 360 degree panoramas, and descriptions of physical and digital window displays in a real-time, searchable database of community-generated content that provides data on what retail environments look like around the world with coverage from 1931 to present.​
1. Visit ​WindowsWear
2. Click “Join now” on the top right
3. Select "Academic" on the right
4. Under "existing members" select "FIT"
5. Create profile
6. Under "get started" select "student" or "faculty"
7. Use your FIT email and create a password
8. Click "join"
You will need to login to WindowsWear after authenticating via the proxy to use the site.

name: eMarketer
description: Provides data, insights and perspectives for marketing in a digital world.

name: Fashion Studies Online: The Videofashion Library
description: Spanning almost 40 years, this collection includes over 1,200 hours of videos of runway shows, designer profiles, and documentary films including coverage of the major fashion weeks in Milan, Paris, New York and London, as well as Miami swim and New York bridal collections.

name: Women's Magazine Archive
description:
Contains an archive starting in 1883 to 2005 for eleven magazines typically marketed to women, with high-resolution color scans and feature detailed article-level indexing. Titles and specific coverage includes:

- Better Homes & Gardens (1922 - 2005)
- Chatelaine (1928 - 2005)
- Cosmopolitan (1926 - 2004)
- Essence (1970 - 2005)
- Good Housekeeping (1885 - 2005)
- Ladies’ Home Journal (1883 - 2005)
- Parents (1926 - 2005)
- Redbook (1903 - 2005)
- Seventeen (1944 - 2005)
- Women’s Day (1937-2005)
- Women’s International Network News (WIN News) (1975-2005)

name: Harper's Bazaar Archive
description:
Harper's Bazaar is the world’s oldest continuously published fashion magazine, with coverage starting in 1867 to present with additional access to the UK edition from 1929-2015, both of which are fully indexed and searchable.

Harper's Bazaar (US): 1867-Current

Harper's Bazaar (UK):
April 1930-Dec 1969

Harpers and Queen (UK):
Jan 1972-Dec 2000

Harper's Bazaar (UK):
Jan 2007-Dec 2007

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Kanopy
description:
Video streaming platform for global documentaries and classic films. FIT Library subscribes to a very limited number of titles, please log in to see the full list.

Use an incognito browser to access this resource.

name: Dissertations & Theses @ Fashion Institute of Technology (ProQuest)
description: Provides access to the dissertations and theses produced by students at FIT.

name: Archive on Demand
description: Archive on Demand is an online video platform created by the FIT Library, including videos of lectures and events that occur on campus, available online to the FIT community and the general public.

name: EDITED
description:
Real-time access to retail data to make informed product, marketing and pricing decisions.

New users must request an account -- send an email to EDITED via support@edited.com from your FIT email address, providing the name of your major, year of study, and graduation date (month and year are fine); check your email for a reply and login details.

Faculty -- please indicate you are an instructor for access beyond one semester.

name: Business of Fashion (BoF)
description:
1. Click to register for BoF Professional: https://www.businessoffashion.com/register
You must use an FIT email address.

2. Check your inbox for a confirmation email and click the link to confirm your membership (this email is sent from: noreply@businessoffashion.com)

Tip: Be sure to check your spam inbox and add BoF as a contact to ensure you receive future emails and newsletters.

3. Once confirmed, you will automatically get full access to your own BoF Professional account.

For help, please contact BoF at professional.groups@businessoffashion.com

BoF Professional provides unlimited access to articles, exclusive analysis and briefings, case studies, special reports, online learning courses, the iPhone mobile app as well as invitations to digital and in-person events.

name: Sophicolor
description:
A color service with more than 4,500 unique colors. Includes Trend Intelligence with the latest color palettes.

Extensive cotton color swatch collections

Register for an account here using your FIT email. Select "Design Clients" -- https://www.sophicolor.com/register

In the Company field, enter "FIT," and for job title enter "FIT Student" or "FIT Faculty"

You will receive an email from Sophicolor once your account has been approved.

name: WGSN Insight
description:
Consumer, marketing, retail, and innovation trends

Students must create an account and re-activate their account every 90 days: click to create or re-activate account: https://www-wgsn-com.libproxy.fitsuny.edu/accounts/edu

To access WGSN Insight:

login via the proxy and then with your WGSN username and password
select the part of the site you wish to use from the top menu under "Fashion"
Use an incognito browser to access this resource

name: SPARC Digital
description: SPARC Digital is a platform created by FIT's Special Collections and College Archives to showcase the rare and unique materials from our collections that have been digitized. Our goal is to make our collections more widely available online to the FIT community and the general public.

name: Slavery in America and the World: History, Culture & Law
description: Legal materials on slavery in the United States and the English-speaking world, including every statute passed by every colony and state on slavery, every federal statute dealing with slavery, and all reported state and federal cases on slavery.

name: Social Sciences Full Text
description: English language journals in the field of social sciences.

name: MEDLine with Full Text
description: Medical journals, full text from 1940s- current, some abstracts & indexing 1800+.

name: Gun Regulation and Legislation in America
description: Covers the subject of gun control and legislation with access to 550 periodicals, key compiled federal legislative histories, relevant congressional hearings, CRS Reports, and Supreme Court briefs. These include the National Firearms Act, the Miller and Heller decisions, and other key aspects.

name: Another Magazine Archive
description: Full text coverage of Another magazine from 2001-current

description:
Register for a WWD Digital Daily account using your FIT email address. Once registered, the daily edition of WWD will be sent to your email.

New registrations take 3-9 days to become active.

Access WWD Digital Daily through this WWD Digital Daily link and not through WWD Online.

Reset your password using this link: https://wwd.com/help/

name: Bloomsbury Fashion Business Cases
description:
Presents real-world business cases on challenges facing the business of fashion, tackling important issues such as sustainability, technology, ethics, and leadership.

Use an incognito browser to access this resource.

name: Bloomsbury Fairchild Books Library
description:
Includes textbooks.

Ebooks covering a full spectrum of topics in fashion including construction, draping, fashion business management, history, illustration, journalism, marketing, promotion, theory, pattern making, styling, product development, sustainable fashion, textiles, and more.

Full-text versions of books from the fashion textbook publisher, Fairchild Books.
Use an incognito browser to access this resource

name: Library of Congress Open Access
description: Approximately 500 ebooks available from the Library of Congress

name: HeinOnline
description: 182 million pages and 281,000 titles of historical and government documents; comprehensive coverage from inception of more than 2,800 law-related periodicals, the entire Congressional Record, Federal Register, and Code of Federal Regulations, complete coverage of the U.S. Reports back to 1754, and entire databases dedicated to treaties, constitutions, case law, world trials, classic treatises, international trade, foreign relations, U.S. Presidents, and more.

name: Ebony Magazine Archive
description: Ebony magazine coverage from 1945-2014

name: Esquire Magazine Archive

name: Chronicle of Higher Education
description:
Go to Chronicle.com (https://info.chronicle.com/dc/zbHR4ckLk3NHbAZ4q6lj2fQwfe3xQKH854YheSVthRKNa1OrLzEyqfxCILYS7YLpWpl1Pc5rkARhI7pwgbnxPA==/E0U0E21qKTR0f0pA3M0AE04) and click on the “Log In” link at top, right-hand side of the page or visit this link:
https://info.chronicle.com/dc/zbHR4ckLk3NHbAZ4q6lj2XLhhgkB65SjDNlJQ6bf_mECK4F8xB9TmUxE9SPCejbNdrD2TdMiFeIi00TDgnjAFNIMopnVH-PsXf2Ywj9tulA=/E0U0E21qKTR0f0pA3M0AE04

Choose the “Create an Account” option

Create a free account using your institutional email address. You also have the option to sign up for The Chronicle ’s free email newsletters during the registration process.

Activate your account by confirming your email address. Look for an email from circulation@app.chronicle.com with the subject line “The Chronicle: Confirm your email address.”

name: Gale OneFile Popular Magazines
description: General-audience and scholarly articles on all topics, and some ebooks 1980- current.

description: Coverage of The New York Times from 1985-present.

name: Gale OneFile Culinary Arts
description: Contains full text articles and citation indexing for more than 250 major cooking and nutrition magazines, as well as book reference content from Delmar from 1984 to present.

name: EcoTextile News
description: Ecotextile News magazine focuses on environmental issues in the global textile and clothing supply chain, and is published six times per year. Our subscription includes premium content and access to back issues from 2007+

name: Bloomsbury Open Access
description: Open access ebooks published by Bloomsbury.

name: LGBTQ+ Source
description: Contains the content of LGBT Life and full text of more than 120 of the most important and historically significant LGBT publications.

name: Intellect Fashion Collection
description: Provides access to scholarly publications in the Intellect Fashion Collection

name: Air Mail
description:
Sign up to receive weekly newsletters using your FIT email address:
https://airmail.news/subscribe/group/fit

name: Alt HealthWatch
description: "Complementary and alternative medicine" articles and pamphlets from 1990 - current, indexing 1984 - current.

name: Article First
description: Listings of online scholarly articles that are not necessarily available through FIT; check individual listings.

description:
Available to Art Market Studies graduate students only.
Please use Ask the Library to request password: https://fitnyc.libanswers.com/

name: Associates Programs Source
description: Contains a variety of topics of general interest from trade publications as well as popular magazines.

name: Bloomsbury Fashion Central
description:
Access to:
Berg Fashion Library
Fashion Photography Archive
Fairchild Books Library
Bloomsbury Fashion Business Cases
Coverage of world fashion from 1500 BCE to present, including books, scholarly articles, and an extensive image collection including the V&A Museum's fashion collection (1600 images); the Philadelphia Museum of Art (2800 images); the Bath Fashion Museum (970 images); the Commercial Pattern Archive (2200 images); the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Costume Institute collection (2000 images); and the MoMu Fashion Museum, Belgium (600 images).

Use an incognito browser to access this resource.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Britannica Academic Edition
description: Encyclopedia with a searchable and browsable collection of authoritative references, including Britannica's latest articles, hundreds of articles not found in the print Britannica, Merriam-Webster's Collegiate Dictionary (Tenth Edition), the Britannica Book of the Year, and links to non-Britannica sites curated by Britannica editors.

name: Gale OneFile Economics and Theory
description: Covers over twenty million articles, including full text coverage of over 1000 publications from 1980 to present. Contains academic, trade, and scholarly peer-reviewed materials.

name: CHIN (Canadian Heritage Information Network)
description: Open access database covering Canadian art history, archaeology, art conservation, history, museum studies, intellectual property, and the natural sciences, including (among others) Artefacts Canada, Artists in Canada, Canadian Heritage Information Network's Data Dictionaries, and Canadian Heritage Information Network's e-News.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: CINAHL Plus with Full Text
description: Contains articles and abstracts for nursing and allied health journals starting in 1937, providing full text for more than 770 journals indexed in CINAHL.

name: Gale OneFile Communications and Mass Media
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 400 journals on all aspects of the communications field, including advertising, public relations, linguistics, and literature from 1984 to present.

name: Gale OneFile Computer Science
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 600 journals and periodicals, including the computer, telecommunications, and electronics industries from 1967 to present.

name: Computer Source
description: Contains full-text for nearly 300 publications and indexing and abstracts for nearly 450 publications on computers, telecommunications, electronics, and the Internet, with most coverage starting in 1985.

name: Costume
description: Full text access to Costume journal from 2000-current.

name: Gale OneFIle Criminal Justice
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 250 periodicals for those studying law, law enforcement, or terrorism, training for paralegal service, preparing for a career in homeland security, delving into forensic science, investigating crime scenes, developing policy, going to court, writing sociological reports, and much more, with coverage from 1981 to present.

name: Coloro Workspace
description:
New users must register for a free account: https://int.coloro.com//customer/account/create/

A digital tool to explore and work with all 3,500 colors in the Coloro system, allowing you to play with them in different ways.

name: DOAJ: Directory of Open Access Journals
description: Provides full-text open access journals covering all scientific and scholarly subjects. To be included in the DOAJ, journals must use a funding model that does not charge readers or their institutions for access and must exercise peer-review or editorial quality control.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Gale OneFile Diversity Studies
description: Access to articles that explore cultural differences, contributions and influences in the global community

name: EBSCO Databases: Multiple Databases Search
description: Search across multiple databases and subjects at one time.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: eBooks (FirstSearch)
description: Listings of e-books that are not necessarily available through FIT; check individual listings.

name: ECO: Electronic Collections Online (FirstSearch)
description: Listings of online scholarly articles that are not available in full-text on this database but may be available in full-text from other databases through FIT; check individual listings.

name: Edinburgh University Press
description:
Full-text access to the following journal:
Costume: https://www-euppublishing-com.libproxy.fitsuny.edu/loi/cost

name: Gale OneFile Educator's Reference Complete
description: Provides full text coverage of education periodicals and reports.

name: Entrepreneurial Studies Source
description: Full-text database containing journals, books, videos, and company proxies providing insights on entrepreneurship and small businesses

name: Fashion Photography Archive
description:
Curated by Valerie Steele, Director of the Museum at FIT in New York, this resource showcases more than 775,000 newly-digitized images that feature forty years of contemporary fashion history. Images range from runway and backstage to street-style fashion, and from key designers’ shows from the last forty years.

Use an incognito browser to access this resource.

name: Fashion History Timeline
description: Open Access resource on fashion history with entries and essays on a wide range of topics such as the fashion of specific periods, garments, films, and artwork.

name: FIT Library YouTube Channel
description: Video tutorials covering FIT Library services, collections, and database access including how-tos for researching specific subjects.

name: Gale OneFile Fine Arts
description: A collection of articles, case studies, transcripts, videos, and images from a range of publications, including peer-reviewed, scholarly, industry-focused, and general audience from 1980 to present.

az_types.name: Art History & Fine Arts, Illustration, Photography

name: Fuente Académica Plus
description: Over 1,600 Spanish- and Portuguese-language scholarly and popular sources from Latin America, Spain, and Portugal covering a wide range of subjects, including history, economics, literature, sociology, and law, available as full-text PDFs.

name: Gale in Context Middle School
description: For Middle school students. A collection of videos, newspapers, magazines and primary sources on topics of literature, science, social studies, and history.

name: Gale OneFile Business
description: Peer-reviewed, scholarly, popular, and trade publications across business-related topics, including company information, accounting, business theory, economics, management, marketing and more from 1980 to present.

name: Gale OneFile Health and Medicine
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing for more than 2,500 periodicals, reference books, pamphlets from 1983 to present. Also contains hundreds of videos demonstrating medical procedures and live surgeries.

name: Gale OneFile Hospitality and Tourism
description: Contains full text articles, abstracts, and citation indexing from 1981 to present for more than 17 million articles on the cultural and economic aspects of travel and tourism. Also includes content on state parks and information on planning a vacation to full-text travel guides from Fodor's.

name: Gale OneFile Military and Intelligenace
description: Scholarly journals, magazines, and reports covering all aspects of past and present military affairs.

name: Gale OneFile Information Science
description: Covers all aspects of managing and maintaining information and technology.

name: Gale OneFile Insurance and Liability
description: Provides access to information on the protection of assets, physical or intellectual.

name: Gale OneFile Leadership and Management
description: Topics include 21st-century skills, organizational dynamics and leadership, adult learning and continuing education. Full-text articles for over 400 journals, coverage dating back to the 1980s.

name: Gale OneFile Science
description: With access to over 1.6 million items and articles, this resource includes a full range of science information, including peer-reviewed, scholarly, and general interest titles as well as video content from various producers, including Nova and AP News.

name: Gale OneFile Religion and Philosophy
description: Topics cover the impact religion has had on culture throughout history, including literature, arts, and language. Full-text articles from more than 250 journals dating back to the 1980s.

name: Gale OneFile U.S. History
description: Original and curated content on all aspects of U.S History. This includes Gale-created materials along with titles from 120+ notable publishers, thousands of newspapers and journals, and more than 175 million pages of primary sources.

name: Gale OneFile Vocations and Careers
description: Contains full text articles from 1984 to present from more than 300 titles for those researching a vocation, finding an appropriate institution of learning, job searching, and maintaining a career.

name: Gale OneFile War and Terrorism
description: Contains full text from 1970 to present for more than 1.7 million articles from 200 journals for analysts, risk management professionals, and students of military science, history, and social science.

name: Global Apparel Markets
description: Access to quarterly analysis on the global apparel industry, including relevant trend, trade, policy, and retailer information.

name: Health Source Consumer Edition
description: Contains full-text articles, magazines, and reports from 1984 to present on fitness, nutrition, diabetes, aging, women's health, children's health and more with access to 80 full-text magazines, 110 full-text reference books, more than 18,800 Clinical Reference Systems reports.

name: Health Source Nursing/Academic Edition
description: Contains full-text articles, indexing, and abstracts for more than 250 peer-reviewed journals from 1952 to present focusing on pediatric nursing, critical care, mental health, nursing management, medical law and more.

name: Ingenta Connect
description: Largest resource for access to articles from scholarly publications (some full text)

name: Library, Information Science & Technology Abstracts with Full Text
description: Range of publications covering all aspects of librarianship and information management

name: LinkedIn Learning
description: Access training tutorials via the MyFIT platform.

name: Military and Government Collection
description: Current news from magazines and journals pertaining to all branches of the military.

name: New England Journal of Medicine
description: Full-text articles 1990 - current (indexing and short summaries only for 1812 - 1989).

name: Newspaper Source Plus (EBSCO)
description: Articles and images from US and global English-language newspapers and tv & radio news transcripts, from 1985 - current

name: Open SUNY Textbooks
description: OER (Open Educational Resources) textbooks written by SUNY faculty.

name: Performance Apparel Markets
description: Full text of the quarterly publication covering global perspectives on performance / active sportswear and the fibers, fabrics and manufacturing processes used.

name: Project Gutenberg
description: Includes classic literature published before 1923. Full-text of over 60,000 ebooks in the public domain.

name: Regional Business News
description: Includes more than 80 regional business newspapers, journals and radio and tv transcripts, covering all metropolitan and rural areas in the United States. Coverage dates back to the 1960s.

name: Religion and Philosophy Collection
description: Topics includes world religions, major denominations, biblical studies, religious history, epistemology, political philosophy, philosophy of language, moral philosophy and the history of philosophy. Full-text articles from more than 300 journals dating back to the early 20th century.

name: Taylor and Francis Online
description:

name: Textile Outlook International
description: Comment and analysis of the global fiber, textile and apparel industries.

name: Tutorials
description: Video tutorials for databases and information literacy topics

name: Vocational and Career Collection
description: Contains content from 1985 to present on a wide variety of vocational and technical subjects with access to 330 full-text journals and magazines - including National Geographic Magazine from 1901 to present.

name: WorldCat (FirstSearch)
description: Index of a wide variety of resources and the tools to help find which libraries hold them.

name: Academic OneFile
description: General-audience, trade publication and scholarly articles on a wide range of subjects, 1980-current.

name: Booklist
description: Print and audiobook reviews

name: Ethnic Diversity Source
description:
Available through November 20, 2021
Covers culture, traditions, social treatment and lived experiences of:
African Americans, Arab Americans, Asian Americans, European Americans, Jewish Americans, Latinx Americans, Native Americans, Multiracial Americans
4,500+ full-text e-books from the Diversity & Ethnic Studies eBook Collection
2,000+ full-text biographies
6,300+ primary source documents
300+ full-text speeches
2,000+ full-text letters
4,000+ full-text interviews
600+ historical documents
600+ relevant, curated videos from the Associated Press

name: Diversity & Ethnic Studies eBook Collection
description:
Available through November 20, 2021
Includes nearly 5,000 e-books on the topic of diversity, equity, and inclusion
